S.FORM: margi mumu. singsi ka nuburuburu ma mwa ku akanata pang Teldrekane spasobékénidria.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的茂林語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Teldreka.

S.FORM: urgu musu bicilringi ku spasobkéni ki singsi?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: singsi, ilrigu kwa, duruma kula kuvale musobakala?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?
我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: cngla kené! ngélava kwa isisipi kuvale.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pencil.
I forgot to bring my eraser.
請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: tathémanga kené asulutata. skakulanenga géciobi tapcacngle.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: Valedra kua Mumu du, Kanau kɨkɨ.
S.TRANSL: I am Mumu's son, my name is Kanau.

S.FORM: seto dra Mumu du, Kanau kɨkɨ.
S.TRANSL: I'm a student at Mumu, my name is Kanau.

S.FORM: kini ka kakinema sovlé. Aras mania.
S.TRANSL: He's my brother, his name is Arase.

S.FORM: Ipulu kini. kini ka gilidri abéya ninema.

S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Mrinu。
She is my friend, her name is Milrinu.

S.FORM: cacevélé ka pidra cvélé ni kini?
cacevélé ka makemangsale kudru sa cvélé kini.
cacevélé ka pidra cvélé ni mami mwa?
cacevélé ka mrémele cvelé ni mamin nema.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: ikéng kwa sesa kaka sovlé sesa kaka abéya, drusa na kaka, sesa gili sovlé, sesa gili abéya.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: iku mamimwa ka aci ku sidepani kini?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?
Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: teresɨ musu ki mama si nina iké danɨ?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: iyo, terese kɨkɨ ki mama si nina iké dane.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: teresɨ musu ki mumu si kakuringo iké danɨ?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

S.FORM: aci ku steresɨ su iké danɨ?
terese kɨkɨ ki mama, nina si kaka sovlé iké dane.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
Our home is in Mau Forest.

S.FORM: ika tékadra da mu ku yiene?

S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: akina tébabarvia na klapane ka sivilri kɨkɨ mua.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: orosunga avé, sakura marpa na viene.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: iktatlɨkɨ si ikɨrapa sesa, sakura margi.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: tɨbɨlɨnga tédra na kurungu, mubuelɨnga cacɨngalɨ.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.
雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

S.FORM: sakura matilɨke na viɨne, skupia pkadro.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: adrara nudalema sukura, ngulringava emɨcɨ na thkebe.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.
剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.
好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.
有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: udale blate, si imɨcɨ kɨkɨ na thkebe.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: tradro na bsɨsɨ, absɨbsani ka utrɨtrɨ oruli.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: sakura na ucɨngtre. acengɨrvani ka mabusu ku oruli.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.
I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: iyo, nolongé ma kɨkɨ na sidisidisi iya.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: tuwa longé ku nu tikierata ni?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: nukane ma kɨkɨ gakko ku tékangna ni yiobung na kedrali.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: emɨcɨ kɨkɨ sasa na kiere. vévanenga ka tatkere sɨ kuene.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: éni, nu sisipima kɨkɨ na sulate.

S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: iyo, kené suepe ka kubé swa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: pusopra kwa marala na kulopla sididisini?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: usususuepɨla kɨkɨ, kokuva kana va pusopra kwa mra mia.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor and you asked Kacaw to carry it for you. *[Kacaw] Please change the name to men of all races.

S.FORM: makulungu déda githigithi, mua disidisi la.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: iyo, kuwala mra na keropla sdrisidrisi.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: kedro tavenga sakura makulungu, mua disidisi.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.
等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.
What do you do after school?

S.FORM: ngerese ma kɨkɨ séli mua thɨné.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: kukbuburula swa iké dane ki Luvai?

S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: kukbuburula swa iké dane ki Luvai?

S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, this is Palau, please open the door.

S.FORM: Vauso! Mumuni kɨkɨ, mukani kɨkɨ silepe swa taplilivi.
S.TRANSL: Vausu!I am Mumuni and I have come to play with you.

S.FORM: iyo! sakura kɨkɨ sikidredre me swa. mukunia lribungu tapabkala.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: aii! ocia mu ka sakura margi unglumdɨ.
margi! margi kené kudamono cngle madɨ.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: tékangnenga repenge nina kiubu, lribunga mukuné kuene.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: kuenee si unglu, ikemani musu na skécavene.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I'm full.

S.FORM: giamanga kɨkɨ, skakulanenga ka kené makɨ cngle swa.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

S.FORM: iyo, ikédra samoru kené makɨ bɨrlelé.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: margi mumu, sesa ka nemɨcɨ mamua singsi mua cɨkɨcɨkɨle kububuru marudrɨnge.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: margi! teldrekane ma kname musobaka ku marudrenge.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說茂林魯凱語。
Yes! We’re going to speak Maureen Rukai to the seniors.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: aii! Urgu mumu Teldrekane! matkadre ngé ka yulane.
S.TRANSL: 你們會說茂林魯凱語啊!真是太棒了!
(sighs) You guys speak Maureen Rukai! That’s great!

S.FORM: margi mumu sesa ka singsi numɨcɨ ma mwa, mua tɨbɨcɨnga tomuma.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: mukunia ngurubua idilipi, ngulringava emɨcɨ ku maka sakiké nga.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: iyo, singsi. angculu kname mra ku maka saki kénga.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: mua mra ku sibisibisi na rarame.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: iyo, nuuwa ma kɨkɨ bisi rarame.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: margi mumu, sesa ka nuwa ma miti ku tékikadra makagulugu lénga.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: mungurubua na idilipi, nolengémanga miti na kipu.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: tulucubunga ka makararamenga, kodrenga ka maka susuranga, mungikmania mua cngcngle.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: icizikang midranga ka nusarbu ma miti musivilria.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: ucngle kɨkɨ madro na sura, si ikéla madro na rarame.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.
Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: kené iké madro na ico iké lunglungé
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: sakura téburo kedro na acɨlé, iké ta kené lunglungé ka margi.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: kiuda su na sudo sia mukuké?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

S.FORM: ungténg ma sudosia ki mama pikiudu kwa ngerese mua.

S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: kiudu na ciéyng kini mua gakko.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: yumaneni ki kakurongo muini longé lecenge?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: angtobai kini na muini longé lecenge.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: nungo Vange ma kɨkɨ mua Langi.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: kiudani kini na sudo sia mua Takao?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
Yes, he took a train to Taitung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: tapara kené ka iké na tétetera na sudosia?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: iké, avétha tulucubunga dovdavece cngle ma tétetera sudosia.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: kené midalinga na ciéyingcang ka ika téka dra?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: kené ka tédra na ciéyingcang, nukiudu ma musu na hayia.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: kiudutana basu nukutharadra si luva gakko?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: mngesle kirima na punkang ka amua gakko.
kiudu ta kautié ka nukupia dra na zikang luwa Taiciu?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: uténg mia sudosia mua Ulai ka midaveli?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: kiudusu na cieying mukuné dali ka midaveli?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: duru ma kɨkɨ kububu ru swa?
duru ma kɨkɨ kububu ru swa?

S.TRANSL: Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: vévanenga ka iké swa samoru? pakdredreme kuvania kububuru ma kɨkɨ swa ipulri ngo?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: margi, nukéma kɨkɨ dane drodro swa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: iké swa na samoru kusianga? kukbuburu nia ma kɨkɨ pakdredreme ku yienela na Drukaizuku tibuburu.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於茂林魯凱的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary story of Maureen Rukai.

S.FORM: kusianga ka nuua ma kɨkɨ rgerge, nukiakɨ dane.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: ubicilringi kɨkɨ na bka, musu ka sakura urgu ku tumane ni sarkiké ni, na Drukaizuku ma kukbuburu nia ma kɨkɨ swa pakdredreme.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對阿美族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Amis, so I would like to ask you a few questions. *Please change [Amis] to your ethnic group.

S.FORM: ikadro ku alriguali, makasi iku alriguali ka nubiri makswa.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: kukbuburu swa duru makɨkɨ lruing mia? inatuménia ka udaduru saulute.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: kukbuburu swa pidra cvélé su cacvélé?
kukbuburu la swa iku asirasu ka Drukaizuku?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是魯凱族人嗎?

S.FORM: aciku alrigua su musobaka na bka?

S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。

S.FORM: sakura kɨkɨ na mabebere duru kububuru swa, alamusobaka, tumani na ulupu ku kilrisiani ni?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: margi. iku athabrelila ka sakurakɨ sitalese mua rgerge ulupu.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: takedrengésu sesaku sububuru su sakura na margi.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: spasobkélinga matakadrengé kini, amani ki lomumu ku spasobké ni yienɨkini.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: sesa ku kibuburualeli tathémangakené, takedre ngé su tumasu nia masiarara.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: nugia nga kɨkɨ, si skakulanega kedrama nladronga na sitibuburu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: nolengé am kɨkɨ ngesa na kopu.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: nolengé ma kɨkɨ ngesa na turupungu.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: nolengé ma kɨkɨ na kopu, iké olengé mumu?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: nung piyia su na thubungu longé?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: nolengé ma kɨkɨ ngidusa na cukini sɨsɨ.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?
How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: nolengé ma kɨkɨ ngidusa na tingitingi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: nolengé ma kɨkɨ ngidusana ebeke tngareva.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: kené ka turu na ebeke na kiara. pkaculu makɨ swa bwi.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: kené écubo na pgé ka pidra pésu.
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: sesa na cubo ka drusa na edé.
paperesenga ka mupole kesasane pésu, mposle ka maragi.
kené ka mvangte klrima na pésu.

S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: ngiculu nga ka lrima na edé lakmangsale na pésu.
kené ka sakura makecengé, dueu ma tmere ngitiki ci?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: eni, kené ka sakura na timerenga.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: nora ma kɨkɨ kené cubo na pingkang.
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: kené pingkang ka mtuku na pésu, ikéla norasu druma na makainunga?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: duru ma kɨkɨ késédeme swa pésu?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: maimuru kɨkɨ emɨcɨ na pésu duru ma kɨkɨ késédeme swa na pésu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: maimuru kɨkɨ emɨcɨ na pésu duru ma kɨkɨ késédeme swa na pésu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: éni, iku késdama su kwa pésu ésévérela musu kwa.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: duru makɨkɨ késédeme swa na kipingila?

S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: iyo, makasi kusianga ka sovriya kwa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: udalenga, imɨcɨ kɨkɨ na thɨkebe pkésésada mala kwa thɨkebe su ni?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?
我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: kené ka amani pakésédama su kwa sulate sévélé makɨ swa.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: aci ku pakedredre ma su kucnglela na silate mia musobaka kwa.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: nugene na sovilrili swa na pésu.
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?
沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: nugenenga na sovilri su kwa pésu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?
I will return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: nugenenga na sovilri su kwa sulate?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?
我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: kené ingpicu ka pakésdama ni swa ki kanau?
S.TRANSL: Did Kanau lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: kené ingpicu ka késdama su dria Kanava?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Kanava?

S.FORM: éni, kené ka alangra dra nina.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: tédra nga na tumusu, mua késdeme Milrnu na ngitiki ci na tumasu.
S.TRANSL: We're out of salt, go borrow some from Panay.

S.FORM: mua tilila mumu nina sovlria kwa pésu mia.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Panay to give me back my money. *[Panay] Please change the name to an ethnic woman.

S.FORM: pidra na pésu ku pusiakia ni swa?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: nua ma kɨkɨ tɨlacenga duku lecenge.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: madronga suro si othɨvathi kɨkɨ, adrala subusubu makɨkɨ na aclé.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: posopalakwa mra kedro tokoko si kevani?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?
我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.
你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: kené tamana ka durumanga kelacenge, kedro lecenge épekepeke ka nuduliala kelacenge.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.
哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
(sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.
Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: suboroni akange adringi madro ku kékanga ninga.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: asaké kɨkɨ sebake akange dingdingi akange.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: urgu musu sarké na pna ulupu?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: wasarké kɨkɨ na tukuru putukuru bɨrɨ, ikénamrelina kuenge si atho ulupu.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: ikené ka sungkédra na vlisɨne dodavece.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: kené ka kepardra vilisɨne sukéni kené ka tdadavecadra vilisɨne.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: tuwalribungu cngle tukuruta aména mutukuru na bɨrɨ.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.
狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: kené ka alapi tene, asarké ptene na tumuthua.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: ikini ka sutukura, kname sarké nia putukuru na thɨkecɨ.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: takedrengé ni lomumu bwi na sakadaru, sesa ka madro.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: iyo! tamɨcɨ mua cɨkɨcɨkɨleta si tapingcɨge padrudruru.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: kɨnésɨsasingsi ka nubrubrumamwa Makagulgulénga na telɨdrɨkane.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的魯凱語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Ngudradrekay language today.

S.FORM: kɨnésɨsasingsi ka nubrubrumamwa mkaserngɨnga na telɨdrɨkane.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的魯凱語怎麼說。

S.FORM: kɨnésɨsasingsi ka nubrubrumamwa kudamono na telɨdrɨkane.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的魯凱語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Ngudradrekay language today.
Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.
我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.
Hello everyone, my name is Arasɨ.
Hello everyone, my name is Ubakɨ.
I am Mrinu, Kukui is my son.
I am Ipulu. Kukui is my older brother.
What is your elder sister’s name?
My elder sister’s name is Mumuni.
What is your younger sister’s name?
My younger sister’s name is DRɨdrɨsɨ.
How old is your elder brother?
How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?
你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?
是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.
你的媽媽從事什麼工作?
你的爸爸從事什麼工作?
不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?
我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?
天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.
It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.
明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?
這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?
那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: kɨnékaidalɨla, vévanɨnga ka nudalɨma mɨpalɨtɨsu nmcathɨkobo.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?
是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.
Will it be very hot in summer this year?
是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.
我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.
我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?
你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?
What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: ikai Mrinu! Ipulukɨ, misu? svridranga ka kutiladra.
S.TRANSL: Mrino不在家耶!我是Ipulu，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Mrino。
Mrinu is not at home. I am Ipulu. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.
奶奶，我們是Mrinu和Ipulu，幫我們開門。
Grandma, we are Mrinu and Ipulu, please open the door for us.
I am Arasɨ, I am here for Ubaka.
Grandma, I am here to see you.
你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Mrino, I am here to play with you.
Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.
這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.
過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: inunua! kani adukali ipsapwenanɨ na lɨpané, alakuenɨ!
S.TRANSL: 請坐!這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.
我不能吃，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.
Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.
我吃了好多，不想再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.
老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.
媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.
老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?
Teacher will take us to the riverside.
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?
不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.
老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.
老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: tuacɨnglɨ adukatalɨpané cngla ikéabungu si vɨlo!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.
老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.
老師，我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: tukcɨnglanɨ la kɨkɨ sesa modripi na tremolo.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: iy! wa! matɨlamɨkua sɨvongvongo, sakwamargi cnglɨmɨde.
S.TRANSL: 耶!哇!我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.
在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.
不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.
How does Mrinu go to school?
Mrinu goes to school by train.
How does Arase go to church?
Arasɨ goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?
Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.
你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?
我搭飛機，飛機比火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.
你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: ungténgkɨsɨtosia mwakiokai ngobasumɨtɨ ka margila ungténgmtesɨdosia
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.
Is the market close to your house?
不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?
出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.
我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?
那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.
請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: ikɨbobaru técavɨnali si ipasɨksɨktɨlakɨ tsɨkɨla, adradria.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?
請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?
我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: ku vlakɨsu ka. iké ckɨlɨmu sɨdanɨ
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: othɨdekɨ sesana atho si sesana raramɨ, thɨkadanɨlii kidri.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: othɨdekɨ ngɨsa ngiyu, ikédra tapɨra kwa ka ikɨthaingongokɨkɨ
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.
我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ikadroarigwali makɨsi ariguali ka nubrimakɨswa tilila
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.
你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?
我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: si bébibé ka uduru kɨsapara ulupu?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?
不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.
Kanao，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Kanao, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.
廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.
我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?
我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.
米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?
I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?
I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.
請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.
Kanau你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Kanao, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?
No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: tumédria, ikésuasamoru ngiubunga? tangudrusa mwa kuenɨ.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?
No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.
你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: borakua ngidrusuaɨbɨkɨ na lcenge si sesatngitngi na purathi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Arase maimurukɨkɨ emcɨ ngipicu, drumamusu psédemekwa
S.TRANSL: Arasɨ，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Arase, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?
I don’t have one either. This is Mrinu’s.

S.FORM: duruma musu psédɨmekwala sɨpéliakɨ si kusɨvéréswa
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank Mrinu for me.
I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?
I would like to borrow these three books.
好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.
You haven’t returned me the eraser.
那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Mrinona?
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Mrino kɨné ɨbɨlɨ ka pakésdemani swa Arasɨ?
S.TRANSL: Mrino, did Arasɨ lend you this coat?
不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.
Arasɨ’s coat is the same as yours.
他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.
Mrino, did you borrow money from Arasa?

S.FORM: iyo, tlunɨli ka sesa kusvérédri makɨ maimurukɨ ɨngmcɨ pésu.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell Arasa for you.

S.FORM: matɨkadrɨngé na poréta tmuthua ka tengnɨ poréta tukuesɨ ka urithi
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套腳式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.
原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: si kuprupru swa tumanɨni pétha kɨné drudrusa sraké tengnɨ si saritha
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: iyo! skargi! tuménidria ka drumangakɨ porabɨrɨ.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: tongmaka dadradronga na sɨro muwa tsɨkɨla mɨra na tɨkoko twa tongma.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: iké tingapa bila mɨdanɨ su tsɨkɨla ka cngɨlɨmamɨsu
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: cngɨla mɨrésu mtulanga musu magɨrangɨ tɨkoko.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.
我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.
這是我的獵區，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
This is my hunting zone, so I know where my trap is.
這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: tédranɨma urungu, srakéknamɨ sɨnagɨnagɨpia nogɨpi akangɨ.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: israkailakɨ na sɨnagɨpia sɨkakulanɨnga ka buburakuani?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: iyo! sɨkakulanɨnga ka tangudrusa mua nogɨnagɨpi.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: si sɨkakulanɨnga ka kupruprusua pétha urungu.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: avlɨvlɨ nɨgépsu nunagɨpiaa kangɨ ibunga blibili.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: adrala, aviɨviɨ avangɨ, kukékɨné plipili sɨnagɨpia muakɨdro psoprakwa mɨra rɨvathɨ.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: mɨra akangɨ blibili pavéthakwa kupsopraswa blibili.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: sɨkragi! madro arata sesa pasɨtɨmiti sɨporo.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.
我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: adra imililivinga, ibunga inunu iké ténunuasu.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: kingyobi sesa, tébarbarvia kusianga, tanguresɨ mubalte mua mililivi ni!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: suiyobi kusianga, twa milili babangɨ na kusianga ni!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: niciobi na kusianga, nunguresɨ ma kɨkɨ ninana mua kiokai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: api tuta kua, nuama kɨkɨ bénzio.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: singsé, utrɨtrɨ brangɨli, nuama kɨkɨ bénzio.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: nu siake manga, adrala si lasa wa.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: singsé, utrɨtrɨ oruli, nu barvi ma kɨkɨ vévanɨnga.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: singsé, skacɨyobinga ka nu barvi ma kɨkɨ mwa pcɨngɨlɨ na koisanga.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.
She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: utrɨtrɨ tuluréni ku Kanau, ébrévé sesa.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kanau has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: Lola kɨkɨ, cacvélé ka makmangsalɨ cvélli.
S.TRANSL: My name is Lola, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?
是的，我們全家都是魯凱族人。
Yes, my whole family is Rukai.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: éni, mama ka Drukaizuku, nina ka Pikisia.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是魯凱族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Rukai, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: mamimua kdroo? pidra nga ku cvélni?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: mamimua kdroo? pidra nga ku cvélni?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: éni, ckɨlɨ namɨ ku maudrangɨ kini, mvarlunga ku cvélni.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: cvélni kakimua sovlé ka tradro la swa ngiadronga?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: cvélni kakasovlé ka tradro la kwa klrima.
skaragreli ka sessa na ɨdé si mthéptele.
médavli ipcacɨnglata nga, tradronga musu yo?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: iyo, skatradroli ka sessa na ɨdé si mutulrulu nga.
iyo, knénga ku skadɨkrɨli ka mutulrulu nga.

S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: iké tulungulungɨra, nuspélia si makɨla ma lungulungé.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ikadra Aruy? nuspélia si nu makɨla mana upidipdakɨ.
S.TRANSL: Aruy在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Aruy? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.
She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: kuwa thiurula mua longé kdrali, adrala si kwa silpe swa.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: mua silpe na ico, nua ma kɨkɨ silpe singsé na.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: makɨla ma sesa Ubakɨ na sukungkungu babangɨ?
S.TRANSL: Is Ubakɨ competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: éni, nu makɨla ma na urububuelɨ maragrɨ.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: ondonkai dria ku vienɨ numakɨla ma musu?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: iyo, numakɨla ma kɨkɨ na updipdakɨ.
ondonkai dria ku vienɨ numakɨla ma musu?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: numakɨla ma kɨkɨ na sukungkungu babange.

S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: numakɨla ma miti na mabablibli tési.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: ondonkai ka nulɨngalɨngé ma miti na akankana?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: éni, nulɨngalɨngé ma miti na babangɨ.
amara musu na iciban yo, makɨcɨngɨ musu!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，你真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: ikai, mobulɨtɨla, ngiyubunga ka lusa siviri.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: iké danɨ garɨ, mua mbɨlɨngɨ silpe nia!
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: Ubakɨ yo, médavlinga ku icɨngɨlali swa, margi musu?
S.TRANSL: 是Ubakɨ阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Ubakɨ. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: margi kɨkɨ! mukanikɨ silpe swa modradrɨke.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: iké tkankana tlacɨnge, kwa koko nia.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.
She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: ikai danɨ ki mumumua, iké toma, drodrovadri mua siviridranga iké danɨ.!
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: médavli nga ipcacɨngɨla ta, maragre nga musu.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: cɨnglɨ madɨ taknianɨsu ka mbebere ku kdrɨdrɨmɨ madɨ.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: sbénɨme mua kné pungudrɨle, apua madɨ podringi pingsiang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: médavlinga ikwaniasu, nanga kiania samia mukné nguresɨ kuenɨ.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: adra ikopungu, nungulu mili na ocia si mekɨtɨnga, nanga si takédanɨ modradrɨkɨ.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: takdrɨngésu tormana kwa, nusiviri manga kɨkɨ.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: kirulathɨ la kné turoka, mra umcɨ pisiviri ngitikii kuenɨ.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.
我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: také mdradrɨsngɨ gakko ni? ta puéga.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: twa tsorsorbwane misu, nuslabingi ma kɨkɨ mua.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: ckɨckɨlɨ namɨ pohanéni sakura ka sakura na margi. tadro na pohanéninga ka mukunia silpekwa ni!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開的時候很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: tuménidria ka nua manga na klatingingisanɨ, médavlingaa!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: kola swa kububuru nugɨne sivirisunga mua ckɨckɨlɨ?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: nakusu ikai ldreke pikisia buburu sulusulute?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: mathrébu kwa ku ckɨckɨlɨli, smarnga laduru kɨkɨ siviri pusopra ckɨckɨlɨ mia.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: urugu musu nunuru, aci ku uburuburu swa?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: amani ku kakurongonɨma, amani urigunga nunuru ku ckɨckɨlɨ namɨ.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: nunuru ka bunkanɨme kini, nipucungucungulu bunkanɨme ma kɨkɨ.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: kné kbava bcɨngɨ matkadrɨngé margi ungulu madɨ.
skakɨcɨngɨ musu, médavlɨ na zikan tbavémadɨ?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: éni, nuama na icingci si mekɨtɨnga. thiuru la madɨ culuku ptidu bcɨngɨ, lapwa satbavne nono ptaresɨ, si podringinga ku mkedrɨsa cɨbakɨ.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: iké kwa kné na tngavlu si lcenge na lokio, angidukali samia!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: nolngé ma knia drusa lcenge, pidra?
ngiculu ka drusa ɨdé si mlrémle na pésu.
madlamɨ kwa nia kné mamɨne, pidra?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: kné mamɨne ka lrima ɨdé na pésu.
makcɨngénga sakura, duria pitimrɨ ngitiki la?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?
No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: iyo msu! kolɨngé ngɨsa tmacɨcrɨngɨ na mamɨne.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要買一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: nolɨngé ma kɨkɨ nia kné saldru si plongo.
S.TRANSL: 我要買這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: ngiculu ka drusa kuzulu na pésu, angipéthali kini, nuduru ma madɨ asarké médavli na zikang.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久的時間。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: kosiokai lséli si lalili nanga longia mia, duru ma musu pitimɨrɨ ngitiki la?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，你可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: iyo iyo, ku pirimrɨ sua pua pace mia.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: nanga cɨngcɨngla! iké alanglangranɨme na mamɨne si turupungu.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: sessa na mamɨne ka tulru ɨdé si mlrémle na pésu, tulru mamɨne ka sessa na kuzulu pésu.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: lngé ma kɨkɨ ngɨsa na mamɨne si mekɨtɨnga, borakwa na bovanɨ la.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: margi musu, apilɨngé kwa vilituru naburo si tékananɨ na makau butulu.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: kélɨngé ngiculunga buro. ikéla kwa na potngarvanɨ na ténpura, nulɨngé ma musu?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: nakuni! borakwa ngɨsa, mukunélinga na skakulanɨ ka kolngé na buro.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: iyo, kupusoprasua buthubungu, tuménia ka mlrémle na pésu.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
